title: ‘Mrs. Fletcher’ Review: A Late-in-Life Awakening
text:
While providing fans of Kathryn Hahn hours of delirium, the seven-part “Mrs. Fletcher” is a bold, engaging, sexy coming-of-age story that may well prompt viewers to ask: What age? The puzzlement isn’t about the birthdate of Eve Fletcher, though she is a bit older than your standard-issue naif of fiction. It’s more about the fact that she’s an extremely attractive, intelligent, divorced single mother in her 40s who lives in the real world, suffers no apparent cognitive impairment, runs an assisted-living facility for seniors and yet seems to have had her soul and libido bubble-wrapped sometime circa Henrik Ibsen.

...
description: Kathryn Hahn stars as a divorced single mother in her 40s who discovers the pleasures of her own life after her son goes to college.
